histogram.name: SBClientDownload.Android.DownloadProtectionOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a download on Android, with respect to Safe Browsing download protection, up until the point of sending a ClientDownloadRequest. This is logged exactly once per download for any download on Android, regardless of Safe Browsing state. This does not record the outcome of the ClientDownloadRequest itself, or the actual verdict if a ClientDownloadResponse was received.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.Android.GetReferringAppInfo.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of getting the referring app info for a download protection ClientDownloadRequest sent on Android. This is recorded after the request is finalized but before it is sent.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.AutoOpen{State}FileType
histogram.summary: Records the extension of files downloaded with auto-open {State}. This can be used to decide the impact of changing the `auto_open_hint` in the file type policy. It is logged on every successful download.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CancelEphemeralWarning
histogram.summary: Records the events related to ephemeral warning cancellation. Compare the bucket count between CancellationScheduled and CancellationTriggered to see how often the delayed task actually got triggered after one hour. The volume of the rest of the buckets should sum up to the CancellationTriggered bucket.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.CheckDownloadStats
histogram.summary:
Records the reason why downloads are marked as being malicious or clean by the improved SafeBrowsing binary download protection. Note that UNSUPPORTED_URL_SCHEME was split out of the INVALID_URL bucket in M41. The NOT_BINARY_FILE check was moved before the UNSUPPORTED_URL_SCHEME check in M42. The ALLOWLISTED_URL check was moved to before NOT_BINARY_FILE in M62. This is logged after download scanned by Safe Browsing.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DeepScanTrigger
histogram.summary: Records the reason each file was uploaded to Safe Browsing for deep scanning. This is logged on every deep scan.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DeepScanType
histogram.summary: Records the type of scan each time a download item starts a deep scan. This is logged on every deep scan.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadExtensions
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of how often users download a file with a file extension that is possibly dangerous (e.g., exe, class).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestDuration{Analysis}
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to check whether the content of a download which underwent {Analysis} analysis is malicious or not, including file feature extraction, allowlist checking, and server ping. This histogram only includes checks that sent a ping to the SafeBrowsing server. It does not include requests that were cancelled, but does include requests that received a bad response.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetworkDuration
histogram.summary:
Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service ping. It is not recorded for requests that were cancelled.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-05-06 to 2021-12-02; data may be missing.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestNetworkResult
histogram.summary: Records the net error or HTTP response code after sending a CheckClientDownloadRequest.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.FileAnalysisDuration{Analysis}
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to check the safety of the contents of a download which underwent analysis for {Analysis}. This only includes file feature extraction. Also see SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestDuration.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.LocalDecryptionEvent
histogram.summary: Records events related to user interaction with local decryption prompts. This includes when the prompt is shown, when it is accepted or rejected, and when the provided password is incorrect.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SavePackageFileCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of files corresponding to a single save package being scanned. This is logged on every save package deep scan.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ServerRequestsDeepScanningPrompt{Encryption}
histogram.summary: Records how often users in a population consented to deep scanning are actually prompted for deep scanning of {Encryption}. This is logged once per download by an eligible user.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ServerRequestsImmediateDeepScan2
histogram.summary: Records how often users in a population consented to immediate deep scans are actually prompted for this feature. This is logged once per download by an eligible user.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ServerRequestsLocalDecryptionPrompt
histogram.summary: Records how often users in a population consented to local decryption are actually prompted for this feature. This is logged once per download by an eligible user.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.TailoredWarningType
histogram.summary: Records the tailored warning type that is shown. Logged when a download warning was shown in the shelf/bubble.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.UserGestureFileType.Attributes
histogram.summary: Records the attributes of a download that is allowed on user gesture. Logged each time a download happens and the danger level is ALLOW_ON_USER_GESTURE. To get the percentage of a specific attribute, divide the number of record of that attribute by the number of record of TOTAL_TYPE_CHECKED.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.Warning.DownloadHasUserGesture.{DangerType}.{Action}
histogram.summary:
Records whether the download was triggered by user gesture when a download warning for {DangerType} is {Action}. The bypassed metrics are recorded when the warning is either bypassed from the download shelf or from the downloads page. By combining the shown and bypassed metrics for a specific danger type, we can calculate whether the bypass rate is different between user-initiated and automatically triggered downloads.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crca-site.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.Warning.DownloadIsHttps.{DangerType}.{Action}
histogram.summary:
Records whether the download URL is HTTPS when a download warning for {DangerType} is {Action}. The bypassed metrics are recorded when the warning is either bypassed from the download shelf or from the downloads page. By combining the shown and bypassed metrics for a specific danger type, we can calculate whether the bypass rate is different between HTTPS downloads and non-HTTPS downloads.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crca-site.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.Warning.FileType.{DangerType}.{Action}
histogram.summary:
Records the type of the file when a download warning for {DangerType} is {Action}. The bypassed metrics are recorded when the warning is either bypassed from the download shelf or from the downloads page. By combining the shown and bypassed metrics for a specific danger type, we can calculate the bypass rate of different file types.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crca-site.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.{ArchiveType}ArchiveAnalysisResult
histogram.summary: Records a more granular reason why we failed to unpack a {ArchiveType} file. This is recorded on every download of an {ArchiveType} file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.{Encryption}DeepScanEvent3
histogram.summary:
Records events related to user interaction with deep scanning prompts. This is recorded a few times during the process of each prompt for deep scanning: - Once when the prompt is shown. - Once when the prompt is accepted/bypassed. - Once when the scan is completed, either through cancelation or completion. This is logged for consumer scans of {Encryption}.
Note: Logging of PromptAccepted was lost in M118. "Scan canceled" and "Scan deleted" were added in M121. "Prompt accepted" was split into "Prompt accepted" and "Prompt accepted from chrome://downloads" in M121.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.{Encryption}MalwareDeepScanResult2.{trigger}
histogram.summary: Records the result of deep scanning {Encryption}, split by the reason the file was uploaded for scanning. This is logged after every deep scan of a download.

variant.name: ConsumerPrompt
variant.summary: Advanced Protection or Enhanced Protection user selected 'Scan'

variant.name: EncryptedConsumerPrompt
variant.summary: Enhanced Protection user selected 'Scan' on an encrypted archive

variant.name: ImmediateDeepScan
variant.summary: Enhanced Protection user began deep scanning automatically

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.AddPhishingReportSuccessful
histogram.summary: Records whether adding phishing report times to profile preferences list before sending ClientPhishingRequest is successful or not.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ApplyTfliteTime.Classify
histogram.summary: Records the duration of running the TfLite classification, which is one step in applying the TfLite model for phishing detection. This model is applied roughly once per navigation.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.BrowserReadyOnClassifierNotReady
histogram.summary: When a renderer-side classification returns the error "CLASSIFIER_NOT_READY", this histogram is logged with whether or not the browser process had a valid model. This can help to identify problems distributing the model from browser process to the renderers.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CancelClassificationReason{RequestType}
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why an in-progress phishing classification was canceled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CancelImageEmbeddingReason
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why an in-progress phishing image embedding was canceled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.Classifier.Event{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records events in the phishing classifier including reasons that prevents phishing detection to complete on the renderer side.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.Classifier.ReadyAfterRetryTimeout
histogram.summary: Records the success rate of renderer-side phishing classification after retries when the model is not available.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClassifyThresholdsResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of classification in visual TfLite model thresholds comparison on the browser side

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientSideDetection.AsyncCheckTriggerForceRequestResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of async check triggering CSD-Phishing classification forced by the request from real-time URL lookup. Recorded each time async Safe Browsing check is completed (note: this only happens when the check goes through async check tracker, which only happens if the Safe Browsing check is slow).

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientSideDetectionTypeRequest
histogram.summary: Records client_side_detection_type in the verdict which denotes which process is responsible for sending the ping to the server. This histogram is logged once on every successful classification.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClipboardCopyApi.PayloadExtraction.SplitStringDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration it took to split the clipboard payload string into tokens. This is recorded each time the clipboard payload is processed for client-side detection.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClipboardCopyApi.PayloadExtraction.SuspiciousTokenCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of suspicious tokens discovered in the clipboard payload. This is recorded each time the clipboard payload is processed for client-side detection.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClipboardCopyApi.PayloadExtraction.TokenCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of tokens created when splitting the clipboard payload. This is recorded each time the clipboard payload is processed for client-side detection.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClipboardCopyApi.PayloadLength
histogram.summary: Records the length of the clipboard payload in characters when a clipboard copy API is triggered on the page.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CreditCardFormEvent2.{EventName}
histogram.summary: Records a credit card form event that may trigger a CSD ping, with an enum that represents the permutation of details for that event. This is recorded on every {EventName} event that may trigger a CREDIT_CARD_FORM classification attempt, after checking for ESB.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CSDPhishingCachedDataAvailable
histogram.summary: Records the times we could have used the CSD images cache to reuse the images for CSD-Phishing classification.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.FlatBufferMappedRegionValid
histogram.summary: Records whether the shared memory region created to hold the flatbuffer was created successfully on not. This is logged on dynamic model update (which is rare), or on each startup.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.FlatBufferScorer.CreationStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status when we create a FlatBuffer scorer object for the client-side phishing detection classifier.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.HasVisualFeaturesImage
histogram.summary: Log whether CSD-Phishing pings contain the visual features image. This is only log when the ping should contain the image (i.e. when SBClientPhishing.VisualFeaturesClearReason is kCanExtractVisualFeatures).

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.HighConfidenceAllowlistCheckDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration it takes for high confidence allowlist check to complete. This occurs in the client side detection PreClassificationCheck.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.HighConfidenceAllowlistMatchOnServerVerdictPhishy{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the URL was on the high-confidence allowlist. Logged when the post classification server model verdict comes back to be phishy.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.HistoryServiceDuration.GetVisibleVisitCountToHost
histogram.summary: Records the duration it takes for calling HistoryService.GetVisibleVisitCountToHost. This occurs for some ping types when determining whether to proceed to preclassification.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ImageEmbedder.Event
histogram.summary: Records events in the phishing image embedder including reasons that prevents image embedding process to complete on the renderer side.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ImageEmbeddingModelLoadTime.FlatbufferScorer
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes the Flatbuffer scorer to load the TfLite model file from the memory mapped file into a string. This blocks the main thread, so we need to ensure it is small.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ImageEmbeddingModelVersionMatch
histogram.summary: Logs whether the image embedding model version is matched or not so that the correctly paired trigger and image embedding model are sent together to the renderer process.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.IntelligentScanVerdict
histogram.summary: Logs what the IntelligentScanVerdict from ClientPhishingResponse was. This is only logged in Client Side Phishing Protection after the server response comes back and the field IntelligentScanVerdict is populated.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.IsOnDeviceModelAvailableAtInquiryTime{OnDeviceModelRequestType}
histogram.summary: Records whether the on device model is available at the time of inquiry. This is logged in the service class at the start of the inquiry function call requested by {OnDeviceModelRequestType}.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.LlamaForcedTriggerInfo.IntelligentScan
histogram.summary: Records whether the intelligent_scan field under LlamaForcedTriggerInfo is set to true or false. This is recorded when the verdict contains the LlamaForcedTriggerInfo.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.LlamaForcedTriggerInfo.LlamaTriggerRuleId
histogram.summary: Records the field llama_trigger_rule_id under LlamaTriggerRuleInfo. This is recorded for every LlamaTriggerRuleInfo under LlamaForcedTriggerInfo.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.LlamaForcedTriggerInfo.LlamaTriggerRuleInfosSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the LlamaTriggerRuleInfo repeated fields. This is recorded when the verdict contains the LlamaForcedTriggerInfo.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.LocalModelDetectsPhishing{RequestType}
histogram.summary:
Records whether the local phishing detection model detects phishing for a specific {RequestType}. This histogram is logged each time the model is run (roughly on every navigation to a non-allowlisted site)
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.MatchCSDAllowlistOn{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records the CSD allowlist match result for a specific {RequestType}.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.MatchHighConfidenceAllowlist{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Record the match result of allowlists for specific {RequestType}. This is logged during the client side detection host PreClassificationCheck.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ModelDynamicUpdateSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether a dynamic update is successful or not. This is logged when a new model is pushed (rare), or on each startup.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ModelDynamicUpdateSuccess.ImageEmbedding
histogram.summary: Records whether a dynamic update of the image embedding model is successful or not. This is logged when a new image embedding model is fetched, or on each startup.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.NetworkRequestDuration
histogram.summary: Records the the duration of a network request due to a client side phishing ping.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.NetworkResult2
histogram.summary: Records the net error or HTTP response code after sending a network request due to a client side phishing ping.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelDownloadSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device model update is successful or not. This happens for Enhanced Safe Browsing enabled users.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelEligibilityReasonAtInquiryFailure
histogram.summary: Records the OptimizationGuideOnDeviceModelEligibilityReason when the model is not available at the time of inquiry. This happens in the client side detection service class when we inquire the model, but the model is not available.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelExecutionDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration it took to execute the on-device model. This happens for Enhanced Safe Browsing enabled users when a keyboard lock occurs on the page they are on and the on-device model session creation is available.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelExecutionSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device model execution is successful or not. This happens for Enhanced Safe Browsing enabled users who called to execute the on-device model when inquiring for scam detection.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelFetchTime
histogram.summary: Records the duration it took to fetch the on-device model after subscription. This is only logged if the update is successful.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelHasSuccessfulResponse{OnDeviceModelRequestType}
histogram.summary: Records whether the on device model inquiry has a successful response. This is logged in the callback after the inquiry call in the host class that was requested by {OnDeviceModelRequestType}.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelInnerTextSize{OnDeviceModelRequestType}
histogram.summary: Logs the size (in bytes) of the inner text extracted from the page when the on device model is inquired. We can use this histogram to inform the size of the context window we need. Note that to convert bytes to tokens, we need to estimate the number of letters in a word and the number of tokens in a word. This is logged when the model is inquired and requested by {OnDeviceModelRequestType}.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelResponseParseSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device model execution result's response parsing is successful or not. This is only logged when the model execution is successful.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelSessionAliveOnDelegateShutdown
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the on-device model session was alive when the delegate is shutting down.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelSessionAliveOnNewPreclassification
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the on-device model session was alive when a new preclassification happens. This is logged when a new request happens through a new preclassification check and the current existing session will be destroyed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelSessionCreationSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether the on-device model session creation is successful. This is logged when the host class calls the inquire on device model function in the service class and the on device model is available. This is expected to be overwhelmingly "success" since we have passed the on device model availability check by the time this is logged.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelSessionCreationTime
histogram.summary: Records the duration it took to create an on-device model session. This happens for Enhanced Safe Browsing enabled users when a keyboard lock occurs on the page they are on and the on-device model session creation is available.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelSuccessfulResponseCallbackAlive
histogram.summary: Records the state of the client side detection host callback object when we respond after the on device model inquiry execution callback completed and the parsing was successful.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OnDeviceModelUnavailableReasonAtInquiry.Android
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the on-device model is unavailable at the time of inquiry on Android. This is logged when IsOnDeviceModelAvailable is called with log_failed_eligibility_reason=true and the model is not available.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.OptimizationGuide.ModelFetchTime
histogram.summary: Records the duration of model fetch time after the OptimizationGuide Model Observer for CSD-Phishing is registered on user session start.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PhishingClassifierMatchOnStrippedEmptyPath{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records whether the stripped GURLs with empty path on browser and renderer loaded URL would have matched when the reference stripped URLs have not.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PhishingDetectionDuration{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records the duration it takes for client side phishing detection requested by {RequestType} to finish. This occurs at the client side detection PreClassificationCheck.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PhishingDetectorResult{RequestType}
histogram.summary:
The result enum received from the renderer-side classifier. This is recorded after every renderer classification (roughly every page load not on the allowlist). {RequestType} indicates which process requested the renderer-side classification.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PhishingImageEmbeddingDuration{RequestType}
SBClientPhishing.PhishingImageEmbeddingResult{RequestType}
histogram.summary: The result enum received from renderer-side image embedder when requested by {RequestType}. This is recorded after every renderer image embedding which is expected to happen when the user is subscribed to ESB, has an image embedding model loaded, and the page is deemed phishy by the phishing classification process.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckCancelActor{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records the cancelling actor of type ClientSideDetectionType when there is a current preclassification check being done by {RequestType}. This is logged whenever an active preclassification check is cancelled.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckResult{RequestType}
histogram.summary:
Records the result of phishing pre-classification checks for a given {RequestType}. This is recorded on every classification attempt for roughly every {RequestType} that comes in.
Starting in M95, the PRIVATE_IP bucket was split to include LOCAL_RESOURCE and CHROME_UI_PAGE. Starting in M137, the children histograms start to log the CLASSIFY bucket.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RedirectChainContainsForcedTriggerInfo
histogram.summary: Logs whether the redirect chain from the classification URL contains URLs that has a ForcedTriggerInfo from RTLookupResponse. This is only logged when the URL that the user is on does not have a ForcedTriggerInfo and the URL contains a redirect chain other than itself. This is only for ESB users.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RedirectChainContainsForceRequest
histogram.summary: Logs whether the redirect chain from the classification URL contains URLs that has a force request from RTLookupResponse. This is only logged when the URL that the user is on does not have a force request and the URL contains a redirect chain other than itself. This is only for ESB users.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RequestTypeAtReportLimit
histogram.summary: Records the request type that would have passed preclassification if not blocked by the report limit. This is logged whenever too many reports preclassification check value is logged.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RTLookupForceRequest
histogram.summary: Records if the RTUrlLookupResponse contains FORCE_REQUEST in client_side_detection_type, which forces the Client Side Detection - Phishing ping to be sent to the server if the user also has Enhanced Safe Browsing or Safe Browsing Extended Reporting opt-in. This histogram is logged once on every successful classification.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.RTLookupForceRequest.HasLlamaForcedTriggerInfo
histogram.summary: Records if the RTUrlLookupResponse that contained FORCE_REQUEST in client_side_detection_type contains the ForcedLlamaTriggerInfo. This histogram is logged if the RTUrlLookupResponse contains FORCE_REQUEST in client_side_detection_type and in the client side detection host class when the FORCE_REQUEST is fetched from the verdict cache manager.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ServerModelDetectsPhishing{RequestType}
histogram.summary: Records whether the server-side phishing detection model detects phishing for a specific {RequestType}. This histogram is logged each time we contact Safe Browsing to evaluate whether a site is phishing.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.TimeSinceLastReportAtLimit
histogram.summary: When CSD service hits the ping limit and we are adding another entry, record the time since last record.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.VerdictParseSuccessful
histogram.summary:
Records the success of parsing the verdict string received from renderer classification.
This metric is used to validate that the verdict can always be successfully parsed when the phishing detector result is SUCCESS

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.VisualFeaturesClearReason
histogram.summary: Log the reason why CSD-Phishing pings do not contain visual features images.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to extract visual features on the main thread. Work performed off-thread is not recorded in this histogram. This is recorded on every phishing classification or image embedding.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime.BackgroundPlayback.Duration
histogram.summary: Logs the duration in PlaybackOnBackgroundThread when extracting visual features. This is recorded on every phishing classification or image embedding. This logs wall time while SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime.BackgroundPlayback.ThreadDuration logs thread time. This metric is logged even for clients that do not support ThreadTicks or have high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime.BackgroundPlayback.ThreadDuration
histogram.summary: Logs the thread duration in PlaybackOnBackgroundThread when extracting visual features. This is recorded on every phishing classification or image embedding. This logs thread time while SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime.BackgroundPlayback.Duration logs wall time. This metric is only recorded for clients with ThreadTicks support. Only recorded for clients with high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to extract visual features. This logs the total duration, including the main thread time that is logged separately in SBClientPhishing.VisualFeatureTime, as well as the time taken on the background thread, up to but not including the execution of the done callback. This also includes queueing time for the posted task. This is recorded on every phishing classification or image embedding.
